sentences.english: In Finland purists insist that only birch bark should be added.
sentences.chinese: 在芬蘭，純化論者堅持說只能加白樺樹皮。

sentences.english: The Nordic birches have long been of special interest.
sentences.chinese: 北歐的樺樹很久以來就特別引人注目。

sentences.english: Birch trees are loosely spread throughout the zone as a whole.
sentences.chinese: 樺樹鬆散地分散在整個區域。

sentences.english: And so I dream of going back to be.
sentences.chinese: 現在還夢想着再去蕩一回樺樹。

sentences.english: The ambulance station consisted of three tents, pitched at the edge of a birch copse.
sentences.chinese: 救護站是在小白樺樹林邊塔了三個卷着邊的帳篷。

sentences.english: The trees were silver birches, four of them.
sentences.chinese: 樹是銀色樹皮的樺樹，一共四棵。

sentences.english: I put the last of my birch bark on the fire and fanned it into life.
sentences.chinese: 我把最後一塊樺樹皮放進火裏，把火煽得旺了起來。

sentences.english: Birches and oaks feathered the narrow ravines .
sentences.chinese: 樺樹和橡樹密生於狹谷中。

sentences.english: Almost each space has a beautiful view on the birch grove and the lake.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每個空間都能欣賞到樺樹林和湖泊的美景。

sentences.english: He was sitting, wrapped in his little military coat, leaning against a birch-tree.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉塔耶夫穿着窄小的軍大衣，靠着一株樺樹坐着。

sentences.english: The silver birch sheds its skin like a snake.
sentences.chinese: 白樺樹像蛇一樣剝脫了老皮。

sentences.english: Under the hoarfrost the slightest twig of birches is white.
sentences.chinese: 在霜下樺樹的最輕微的枝是白色的。

sentences.english: One could do worse than be a swinger of birches .
sentences.chinese: 人能做的事，比蕩白樺樹好不到哪去。

sentences.english: The birch bark culture is an component part of the primitive human culture.
sentences.chinese: 樺樹皮文化是人類原始文化的組成部分。

sentences.english: So was I once myself a swinger of birches.
sentences.chinese: 當年，我自己也是“蕩樺樹“的能手。

sentences.english: But there was so much to see. More precisely, there were so many birch trees to see.
sentences.chinese: 或者更準確一點，是有太多的樺樹可看。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
fire and candles/household things that burn
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
